documents.document: Reminder Remember to submit your abstract for the 1st Nigerian Conference of Applied and Field Epidemiology (NiCAFE). The theme: Building back better: COVID-19 and other disease outbreaks For more information scan the barcode or visit: https://t.co/msfQufFe3q https://t.co/kTBro6blBU

Hand hygiene is one of the most effective ways to reduce the spread of infectious diseases. Encourage the practice of regular hand hygiene among your family and friends to stay healthy. #SecondsSavesLives #OneNationOnePlan #HandHygieneDay #TurnNigeriaOrange https://t.co/kPZKhxtJpY
Today's report includes data from Enugu State recorded between 28th April to 3rd May, 2021. A breakdown of cases by state via https://t.co/zQrpNeOfet https://t.co/apF43Mc4mD
34 new cases of #COVID19Nigeria; Enugu-19 Lagos-13 FCT-1 Kaduna-1 165,215 confirmed 155,371 discharged 2,063 deaths https://t.co/IpbSgo4nAQ

Remember to always adhere to all non pharmaceutical preventive measures of #COVID19. This helps to reduce the risk of spread. Wear a face mask Avoid large gatherings Observe physical distancing Wash hands frequently with soap water #TakeResponsibility https://t.co/ldJ20mlE4S

Let's make regular #handwashing a habit to prevent the spread of infectious diseases. Wet hands with water Scrub both hands together thoroughly for 20 seconds with soap Rinse soap away under running water Dry with a clean paper or hand towel https://t.co/YtCPI0fcNV
Our discharges today includes 2 community recoveries in FCT managed in line with guidelines. A breakdown of cases by state can be found via https://t.co/zQrpNeOfet https://t.co/ArIFPQhboc
18 new cases of #COVID19Nigeria; Lagos-8 FCT-6 Edo-2 Rivers-1 Ogun-1 165,199 confirmed 155,371 discharged 2,063 deaths https://t.co/pzCwr2UYek

"Nigerias health infrastructure was well equipped to initiate contact tracing activities." @Georgetown Center for Global Health Science Security examines the contact tracing approach of 66 countries including Nigeria during the #COVID19 pandemic. Read https://t.co/KH1eqpQhiH https://t.co/OMgXC1Uh1Y

Travel advisory for passengers arriving from Brazil, India and Turkey: Nigerian citizens and resident permit holders from these countries must undergo a seven-day supervised quarantine at a government selected facility at their own cost Advisory https://t.co/ZYykd1lLU8 https://t.co/Th2n7zriiq

Last week, our surveillance team was in Oyo State to support the implementation of the @SORMAS_open tool for surveillance. The team supported the state to train surveillance officers and solve problems relating to our digital surveillance platform. https://t.co/OsXx4QV1rV

Supplementary update for 2nd May 2021 28 new cases of #COVID19Nigeria were reported on 2nd May 2021 Includes 14 new confirmed cases reported in Lagos state, not included in yesterdays report A breakdown of cases by state can be found via: https://t.co/zQrpNeOfet https://t.co/LOAYAsZRYp

Case Update for 2nd May, 2021 28 new cases of #COVID19Nigeria; Lagos-14 Osun-3 Ogun-3 Kaduna-3 Akwa Ibom-2 Abia-1 FCT-1 Kwara-1 165,181 confirmed 155,361 discharged 2,063 deaths https://t.co/0VtqQbDRav

Today's report includes 248 community recoveries in Kwara State managed in line with guidelines. Report is workout data from Lagos State A breakdown of cases by state can be found via https://t.co/zQrpNeOfet https://t.co/200MjyqB5T

We joined delegates from countries, together with @WHO to review progress of the Global Antimicrobial Resistance Use Surveillance System (GLASS). It is vital that countries take deliberate action to address #AntimicrobialResistance using a One Health approach. https://t.co/gaJgJ2r6OK

The Presidential Steering Committee on #COVID19 has released a travel advisory for passengers arriving in Nigeria from Brazil, India and Turkey. Read more: https://t.co/ZYykd1lLU8 https://t.co/27OUNFXDQU
A breakdown of cases by state can be found via https://t.co/zQrpNeOfet https://t.co/AobDSEVT4H

#COVID19Nigeria update as at 1st May, 2021 43 new cases of #COVID19Nigeria; Lagos-28 FCT-4 Rivers-4 Ekiti-2 Kaduna-2 Ogun-2 Bauchi-1 165,153 confirmed 155,109 discharged 2,063 death https://t.co/XlFW1ZlcIe

This week, we supported a two-day training of the network of media professionals in Nigeria on misinformation management organised by @AfricaCheck_NG. The training was to empower the network with the skills and tools necessary for fact-checking addressing misinformation. https://t.co/VQIHpbJY9k

Our Weekly Epidemiological Report #NCDCWER provides updates on epidemic-prone diseases in Nigeria. The editorial for this week (week 14) focuses on the roll-out of the first Intermediate Nigeria Field Epidemiology Training Programme (INFETP). Read more: https://t.co/N05O75ye7p https://t.co/LjoYCDsSHe

We appreciate the commitment of our colleagues other essential workers, our partners stakeholders working with us to protect the health of Nigerians. Together we #KeepPushing to #BuildBackBetter to strengthen our national health security. #StrongerTogether Happy #WorkersDay https://t.co/OWJX0m0CUo

Vaccines help to protect us from infectious diseases that are deadly and have devastating impacts on a countrys economy. When you get vaccinated, you are protecting yourself and our country from the impact of diseases. #VaccinesWork #WorldImmunisationWeek https://t.co/coq45Eoktn
Our discharges today includes 23 community recoveries in Yobe State managed in line with guidelines. A breakdown of cases by state can be found via https://t.co/zQrpNeOfet https://t.co/iRNoqwvBFY
55 new cases of #COVID19Nigeria; Lagos-21 Yobe-19 Ogun-6 Akwa Ibom-3 Kaduna-2 Plateau-2 FCT-1 Rivers-1 165,110 confirmed 155,101 discharged 2,063 deaths https://t.co/OWD5dPfRNw

Today, in collaboration with @FmardNg support of Global Implementation Solution, we concluded a workshop on the finalisation of the One Health contingency plan for Anthrax Brucellosis. This plan will significantly improve lab investments guide prevention control efforts. https://t.co/WYsFqZcpvd

Yesterday, the Nat. Technical Committee of @WorldBank Regional Disease Surveillance Systems Enhancement #REDISSENigeria Project held its quarterly meeting. In our role as project coordinating unit, we continue to work with @FmardNg others to ensure we deliver on project goals. https://t.co/5HP29njWzK

Disregard for #COVID19 preventive measures puts you and everyone around you at risk of getting infected. The ACTIONS you take to limit the risk of spread of #COVID19 PROTECTS the VULNERABLE around you. Our fight against #COVID19 is a collective effort. #TakeResponsibility https://t.co/C5DjnxR0MT

A breakdown of cases by state can be found via https://t.co/zQrpNeOfet https://t.co/BbsklNglQO

Our weekly #COVID19Nigeria situation report(Epi Week 16) has been published. The weekly #COVID19 situation reports provide a summary of the epidemiological situation, datasheet response activities in Nigeria. Download: https://t.co/Xo1WG4QDYT #TakeResponsibility https://t.co/EmxpV1H4Kx

To improve IHR laboratory core capacities within the NRL, @PHE_UK continues to support the External Quality Assurance (EQA) programme. We are grateful to our partners for their support. #UKaid #StrongerTogether

We are grateful for the continued support from the UK's International Health Regulations (IHR) Strengthening Programme in Nigeria delivered through @PHE_uk This includes critical lab reagents and commodities to enhance sequencing capacity for COVID19 and for Diphtheria diagnosis https://t.co/QVez6XlLFd

Call For Abstracts Submit your abstracts for the 1st Nigerian Conference of Applied and Field Epidemiology (NiCAFE) themed: Building back better: COVID-19 and other disease outbreaks For more info, scan the barcode or visit https://t.co/msfQufFe3q Deadline: 21st May 2021 https://t.co/xoUAWk0ga2

To improve IHR laboratory core capacities within the NRL, External Quality Assurance (EQA) was also donated to further strengthen NRLs reference function. We are grateful to our partners for their support. #UKaid #StrongerTogether
A breakdown of cases by state can be found via https://t.co/zQrpNeOfet https://t.co/l6L9GJuW4s

RT @GHS: ACCESS TO VACCINES IS A HUMAN RIGHT. They are essential to building a fairer, healthier tomorrow. #VaccinesWork https://t.co/LS
RT @Chikwe_I: Yesterday, we were part of the 1st press briefing for the Presidential Steering Committee on COVID-19 Our biggest priority-

Our Risk Communications work is highlighted in @ResolveTSL's new report. "Thanks to strong collaboration and coordination among local officials and a rapid response team, a monkeypox outbreak in Akwa Ibom was contained within a month" - @Chikwe_I NCDC, DG Read more https://t.co/GW2LiL2XZB

Today's report include: Data from Enugu State are recorded on the 20th- 26th of April, 2021. Adamawa State cases are recorded over the period of two weeks. A breakdown of cases by state via https://t.co/zQrpNeOfet https://t.co/3QZg7FLSpS

156 new cases of #COVID19Nigeria; Lagos-50 Enugu-43 Adamawa-40 FCT-8 Ogun-5 Akwa Ibom-3 Plateau-3 Jigawa-1 Kaduna-1 Oyo-1 Rivers-1 164,912 confirmed 155,012 discharged 2,063 deaths @Chikwe_I @WHONigeria @nighealthwatch @PTFCOVID19 @NOA_Nigeria @Fmohnigeria @FMICNigeria https://t.co/JOox4LpB1Z
RT @Chikwe_I: Investing in preparedness is much cheaper than in response. But, how, where, by whom? Today, I joined Ben Akabueze, DG B

"We need to ensure we have the framework for financing epidemic preparedness and response. As a country, we need to stand on our own feet and not solely rely on external financing" - @WHONigeria Country Representative #BuildBackBetter https://t.co/RXtFPj3NyC

"The previous ongoing pandemics are evidences of how critical funding is to drive all aspects of public health response. We can not over estimate the impact and importance of this workshop" - Dr. Agogo, @ResolveTSL Country Representative #BuildBackBetter https://t.co/IpzPbs8qwQ

"In the last year, we have worked hard to scale up our ability to respond to infectious diseases strengthen our health systems nationwide with support from @NigeriaGov partners" "We must ensure health security remains a national priority" @Chikwe_I DG NCDC #BuildBackBetter https://t.co/iuTdLv0k1V

In 2018, Nigeria launched a five year comprehensive multi-sectoral National Action Plan on Health Security (NAPHS) Today, in collaboration with @FinMinNigeria @ResolveTSL, we are hosting a multisectoral workshop to discuss financing health security in Nigeria #BuildBackBetter https://t.co/h5ijlW5tBG

It is #WorldImmunisationWeek When we get vaccinated, were not just protecting ourselves but contributing to efforts to protect our country the world Play your part for a safer Nigeria a healthier future, as we jointly support @NphcdaNGs leadership #VaccinesWork https://t.co/NtCnx2AJFk
A breakdown of cases by state can be found via https://t.co/zQrpNeOfet https://t.co/hP20C6vABc

@TYDFoundation handed over 62,000 #COVID19 test kits on behalf of former Defence minister, Gen. T Y Danjuma to @officialnyscng at todays @PTFCOVID19 briefing One year on, the incredible support towards strengthening our national health security has not waned #StrongerTogether https://t.co/We81EV7nKR
RT @Chikwe_I: In a large country like Nigeria, a Joint External Evaluation (JEE) at national level is not enough to assess our country's p
RT @COMOmeningitis: Ahead of #WorldMeningitisDay(24th April) we heard from scientists, people affected by meningitis, advocates, and more

We adapted @WHO Joint External Evaluation tool to assess health security capacity at subnational level in Nigeria This is part of efforts to build resilience for outbreak preparedness response Thanks @WHO @ResolveTSL @PHE_uk @AfenetNigeria for supporting 1st roll out in Enugu https://t.co/yaDn9j41W5
Today report includes: Data from Oyo State recorded on the 24th and 25th of April, 2021. 215 community recoveries in Oyo State managed in line with guidelines. https://t.co/EsWb7SUsUF

Our Weekly Epidemiological Report #NCDCWER provides updates on epidemic-prone diseases in Nigeria The editorial for Week 13 focuses on optimisation of diagnostic capacity for cerebrospinal meningitis through BloTIMA study. Read: https://t.co/N05O75gCIP https://t.co/cFPm5fA53A
RT @WHOAFRO: Can we end #malaria as a public health threat? The simple answer is YES. 4 African countries have already achieved #ZeroMal
RT @NMEPNigeria: Take action against malaria immediately you test positive to it. Malaria can become severe if not treated early. Severe ma

Today is #WorldMalariaDay. In 2020, over 384,000 malaria deaths were recorded in the African Region. Every malaria case is preventable and curable. We continue to work with @NMEPNigeria as part of efforts to #EndMalaria in #Nigeria. #ZeroMalariaStartsWithMe https://t.co/OcLeXxMwpY

"Persons who are affected by #Meningitis suffer some forms of deformities and require special care. Let us advocate and develop after care services for survivors ~ Dr Yahya Disu Head of Risk Communications https://t.co/alWRwMcYkD

Meningitis is an inflammation of the membranes around the spinal cord brain. Seek medical attention when you experience signs symptoms such as: Fever/severe headache Vomiting Drowsiness Rash Seizures Muscle pain Stiff neck etc. Take action, #DefeatMeningitis https://t.co/ZYeSGlcpQd
A breakdown of cases by state can be found via https://t.co/zQrpNeOfet https://t.co/NPDPvZ7d6F
51 new cases of #COVID19Nigeria; Yobe-19 Lagos-17 Rivers-8 FCT-4 Akwa Ibom-2 Bayelsa-1 164,684 confirmed 154,687 discharged 2,061 deaths https://t.co/5F0KEJGPfD

Earlier today, at the #Meningitis sensitisation at Utako market, Abuja: 1 in 5 survivors of #Meningitis suffer after effects such as deafness, loss of limbs, behavioral problems, learning difficulty, etc. - Dr. Priscilla Ibekwe National CSM Technical Working Group Lead https://t.co/CWBfMTSWM4

Recently, we completed the Public Health Emergency Management (PHEM) Basic Level 3 training for frontline responders across the country This is a professional development exercise aimed to strengthen the capacity of responders in effective management of public health emergencies https://t.co/8MBd8YQtWP

Starting #WorldMeninigitisDay at Utako market, Abuja to sensitise the market community on #Meningitis. Meningitis can affect anyone at any age can kill within 24 hours. It is time to #TakeAction to #DefeatMeningitis https://t.co/cucyAQXjAI

ANNOUNCEMENT The maiden Intermediary Level of the Nigeria Field Epidemiology Training Program (NFETP) started this week The NFETP is a competency-based training service programme in public health that builds capacity in strengthening disease surveillance response systems https://t.co/BF1feqhIIE

"26 States in Nigeria are within the African Meningitis Belt" "It is important for everyone to know the signs symptoms to #DefeatMeningitis" -Dr. Priscilla Ibekwe, National CSM Technical Working Group Lead Watch full advocacy video https://t.co/N2p60TpKZt #WorldMeningitisDay https://t.co/twqm1nalzq

#Meningitis is a medical emergency that can be deadly can cause lifelong medical conditions such as brain damage, hearing loss, organ damage limb loss. Early recognition saves lives. Seek immediate medical attention if you experience symptoms. Take Action, #DefeatMeningitis https://t.co/0vDQmRS8HD

Today's report includes: Data from Taraba state recorded between the 11th and 21st of April, 2021 21 community recoveries in Bayelsa State managed in line with guidelines A breakdown of cases by state can be found via https://t.co/zQrpNeOfet https://t.co/Vxqlk1vWiH

Our commitment remains to protect the health of Nigerians, by reducing the risk of spread of the virus. This is why the Nigerian International Travel Portal was introduced by @PTFCOVID19. Well continue strengthening this process to make it seamless for travelers. 3/3

We accept full responsibility for this event, which led to inconvenience for several travelers to Nigeria. We have learnt from this occurrence continue to restructure our systems to avoid future events like this and serve Nigerians better. 2/3

On the 20th of April, a system failure by one of the partner organisations supporting the management of the COVID-19 travel portal led to an unforeseen downtime. The technical failure was resolved following about 12 hours of downtime. 1/3
A breakdown of cases by state can be found via https://t.co/zQrpNeOfet https://t.co/XoI8AkPjZI

In his goodwill speech, DG @Chikwe_I applauded the @BayelsaStateGov for leveraging on the #COVID19 pandemic to improve the State's #healthsecurity "Intervention areas should include an emergency operations centre, infectious disease treatment centre, surveillance systems labs" https://t.co/ZJqc8IdPjr

"I am pleased that @BayelsaStateGov is using the summit to evaluate the States health systems." "An in-depth comprehension will help to articulate a decade-long roadmap for the States revamped health system" - @DrEOEhanire, Hon. Minister @Fmohnigeria https://t.co/LcRutUIGcR

Today is Day1 @BayelsaStateGov Health Summit: "Better Health for All" The Bayelsa Health Summit 2021 is an opportunity to reorganise reinvigorate the State's health system to achieve statewide universal health coverage Better Health for all. https://t.co/nseo2tpXhS
